alert.note: Alert for Lubbock; Lynn; Terry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 10 at 10:27PM CDT until May 10 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN LUBBOCK...NORTHWESTERN LYNN AND NORTHEASTERN TERRY COUNTIES... At 1026 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles east of Petersburg to Ransom Canyon to 12 miles northeast of Brownfield, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lubbock, Slaton, Idalou, Ransom Canyon, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Lubbock International Airport, Texas Tech University, Slide, Woodrow, Buffalo Springs, and New Home. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Lubbock Texas. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
